author: @shrinivasiyengar5799
text: I observed something peculiar. For words ending in "-er" it doesn't always return the root form. For example, it returns "beginn" for "beginner" or "forgiv" for "forgiver", or, as in your example "python" for "pythoner", but returns "maker" for "maker"  or "eater" for "eater" and so on for many other cases. Why does this happen? I do understand we don't always want to cut down the "-er" at the like for "father".
